did.head: Collection Overview
did.unittitle: Slee Visiting Professor in Music Papers, 1957-1993

origination.label: Creator
origination.corpname: State University of New York at Buffalo. Music Department

did.langmaterial: Collection material in English and French.

repository.label: Repository
repository.corpname: State University of New York at Buffalo. Music Library

did.abstract: The collection chiefly consists of correspondence between thirty-two composers being considered or invited to fill the position of Slee Visiting Professor in Music at the State University of New York at Buffalo. It also contains clippings pertaining to the composers.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Specified item], Slee Visiting Professor in Music Papers, 1957-1993, Music Library, The State University of New York at Buffalo.

accessrestrict.head: Terms of Access
accessrestrict.p: Materials can be examined by qualified researchers in the Music Library during hours of operation during which Music Librarians are present. In order to insure access, researchers are advised to contact the Music Library in advance of visits.

userestrict.head: Copyright
userestrict.p: Copyright for the materials in the collection does not reside with the Music Library. Therefore, patrons wishing to publish any item, or part of an item from this collection for any purpose, are responsible for securing requisite permissions.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: Gift of State University of New York at Buffalo Music Department.

accruals.head: Accruals and Additions
accruals.p: No further accruals are expected to this collection.

altformavail.head: Alternate Forms
altformavail.p: The collection only contains photocopies. The original documents are held by University Archives at the University at Buffalo.

bioghist.head: Biographical Note
bioghist.p: The position of Slee Visiting Professor in Music at the University at Buffalo was funded by Frederick Caldecott Slee. Slee (1870-1954) was a corporate lawyer in Buffalo who was also a talented amateur musician who composed and played viola. He and his wife, Alice MacDonald Slee, funded through their estates two major musical events at the University at Buffalo: the annual performance of the complete cycle of Beethoven's string quartets by some of the world's leading string quartet ensembles, and a visiting position in the Music Department to be filled by a leading composer or music theorist of the day. The Slee Visiting Professors presented lectures and recitals of music selected by them. This series of lecture-recitals occurred from 1957 to 1975. The fund was later shifted to be used for a Slee Chair position in music theory within the department rather than funding visiting faculty.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Note
scopecontent.p: The collection chiefly consists of correspondence between thirty-two composers being considered or invited to fill the position of Slee Visiting Professor in Music at the State University of New York at Buffalo. It also contains clippings pertaining to the composers. The folder of correspondence concerning Aaron Copland, who was appointed the first Slee Visting Professor in Music in 1957, is especially noteworthy due to the controversy caused by accusations that he was affiliated with the Communist Party.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The collection is in one series arranged alphabetically by the composers' surnames.

list.item: 1 leaf, January 24 1976 Buffalo Evening News article about Frederick and Alice Slee's funding of the annual Beethoven string quartet cycle
1 leaf, list of Slee Professors at the University at Buffalo Music Department, 1957-1975
1 leaf, January 17 1960 list of composers contacted regarding the Slee Professorship
1 leaf, 1967-1968, Possible candidates for Slee Chair
2 leaves, October 17 1960, from Allen Giles inviting unnamed composer to become the Slee Professorship
1 leaf, December 2 1974 from Terry Charles Schwarz to publisher W. W. Norton concerning inaccuracies about the Slee gift in Philip Hart's Orpheus in the New World
3 leaves, March 1 1967 from Joel Spiegelman to Vladimir Prokofieff
2 leaves, January 27 1993 concert announcement for program including music by Slee Professors
1 manuscript leaf, November 10 1960, from Barber to Allen Giles
2 typescript leaves, November 1 1960, from Berger to Allen Giles
1 typescript leaf, October 25 1960, written by J. W. Cullum on behalf of Britten to Allen Giles
1 typescript leaf, November 3 1960, from Carter to Allen Giles
1 typescript leaf, June 22, 1962, from Carter to Allen Sapp
1 typescript transcription of cablegram sent to Elliott Carter, June 19, 1962, from Allen Sapp
2 typescript leaves, July 19 1957, from Chávez to Cameron Baird
2 typescript leaves, August 12 1957, from Chávez to Cameron Baird
2 clippings about performances of Chávez's music

note.p:
Content from this folder related to accusations about Copland's alleged ties to Communism can also be found in digital form within the summary (see pages 33 and following)of the Music Library's exhibition,
Cameron Baird: Bringing Paul Hindemith and Aaron Copland to Buffalo

14 leaves (manuscript and typescript), July 24 1961- July 12 1966, to and from Haieff, and additional correspondence concerning Haieff

relatedmaterial.head: Related Resources in the Music Library

defitem.item: Inventory of lectures and recitals presented by the Slee Visiting Professors in Music, 1957-1975.
Online exhibit about the lives of Frederick and Alice Slee, with examples of Frederick Slee's prose and musical writing and information about the Beethoven quartet cycle funded by the Slees.
